Authentication attempts using credential.Data: Windows Event ID 4624, Windows Event ID 4625, Zeek conn.log, Zeek http.log
Authentication attempts using credential.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4624 and 4625 for authentication attempts using usernames known to have potentially exposed credentials in public repositories. Analyze Zeek conn.log and http.log for connections originating from unusual external IPs followed by authentication attempts. Use frequency analysis and time series analysis to identify anomalous bursts or consistent patterns of authentication failures/successes for specific accounts.

Inbound network traffic or endpoint acti.Data: Zeek conn.log, Zeek http.log, Zeek smtp.log, Windows Event ID 4688
Inbound network traffic or endpoint acti.Action: Analyze Zeek smtp.log for inbound emails targeting specific employees whose names or roles were potentially exposed. Examine Zeek http.log and conn.log for connections to suspicious domains or IPs from internal hosts, potentially initiated via phishing links. Monitor Windows Event ID 4688 for suspicious process creation activities on endpoints, correlated with indicators from Zeek logs (e.g., process launched after opening a document from a suspicious email).
